flow-definition.description: Clone a git repository to a known location

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETER_UNIQUE_JOB_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Unique identifier for this job which is distinct from the build ID of this particular Jenkins project. The unique ID can be shared with other Jenkins projects to build a pipeline.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETER_REPOSITORY
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Location of a git repository to clone (see: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone#Documentation/git-clone.txt-ltrepositorygt)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETER_COMMITISH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Valid git commit (e.g. SHA, branch name, tag, etc.) (see: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone#Documentation/git-clone.txt-ltrepositorygt)

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETER_CLONE_TARGET_DIRECTORY
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Destination directory for repository clone. REMEMBER: Jenkins is running in a container - check your mounted volumes!

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETER_IGNORE_CACHE
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: If the target directory already exists and is not empty, it will be overwritten. If not, the directory will not be overwritten, and the clone will not be performed.
